page.title: 01Hatherop and District
page.content: The three villages of{Hatherop, Coln {St Aldwyns}and{Quenington}lie close to each other in the beautiful valley of the{River Coln}between Bibury and Fairford. Most of the land in our block is farmland but there is a lot of parkland in the area of the three villages. Most of the houses are built of Cotswold stone. There are records of people living in {Hatherop}since 1042. The original Domesday Book records about two dozen people.Today about one hundred people live in Hatherop. There are two large houses in the village, Williamstrip House and Hatherop Castle. Hatherop Castle is now a private school. There is also a primary school in the village.
